review_title: An excellent, thoughtful, caring place to work
pros: Great environment, lovely people, lovely buildings, good benefits and interesting work. Definitely considers its values when making decisions and tries to live by them, although this is a new approach. it seems genuine. Has high standards and staff work very hard. Actively trying to modernise processes and procedures.
cons: Sometimes oscillates unpredictably between the personal approach and the corporate approach, probably due to its size (not big, not tiny) and diversity (enormous difference in the jobs people do). Salary hasn't kept up with inflation and London/travel costs, though other benefits are generous.
Employee stuck in their ways No push to change Older cohort of staff
